section.name: Building jWebUnit with Ant
section.p: Ant is make for Unix. Most open source Java projects use Ant as their build tool. With ant you can compile, test, package your release with just a few lines of XML code in the build.xml file.

subsection.name: Installing Ant
subsection.p: You need to have Ant installed. The latest version at the moment of this writing is version 1.6.1.
After you've installed Ant, don't forget to set the ANT_HOME environment variable, and to put %ANT_HOME%\bin to your path (Unix users use $ANT_HOME/bin).
And last, but not least, copy the file junit-3.8.1.jar from the jWebUnit\lib directory to %ANT_HOME%\lib, or else your build will fail!

subsection.name: Building jWebUnit
subsection.p: All you have to do is call: ant clean-dist and Ant will do the rest. The java source will be compiled, the javadocs generated, tests performed and a jar-file created.

subsection.name: Building a release
subsection.p: The preferred method of building a release is using maven. However, if you don't want to use maven, you can use ant clean-dist for creating the distribution zip-file.
